books.title: Frankenstein
books.summary: In this classic work of gothic fiction, the titular scientist harnesses the forces of nature to create a monster, known only as 'The Creature'. Who is truly the monster: creator or creation?

books.title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
books.summary: A young girl named Alice enters a fantastic world where rabbits talk, tea parties are full of riddles, and packs of playing cards are truly royal courts.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.summary: The mysterious Gatsby engages in an affair of passion and excess during the Roaring Twenties, told through the eyes of Gatsby's friend, Nick.

books.title: Anna Karenina
books.summary: A story of several noble families in Imperial Russia - their love, their hate, their desires, and the social fabric from which they can find no escape.

books.title: Hamlet, Prince of Denmark
books.summary: One man puts on a play and contemplates life after his father is murdered. Everyone dies.

books.title: Dracula
books.summary: When they're not too busy complimenting each other, a group of bumbling idiots plot to keep an elderly Romanian from immigrating to London.
